properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and increasingly humid airmass will continue to dominate the area. Heat warning criteria is expected to be reached through Tuesday. Significantly cooler temperatures will arrive Tuesday night. Please refer to your public forecast for further details. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-22T17:31:11-00:00

Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and increasingly humid airmass will continue streaming into the regions from the south. Heat warning criteria is expected to be reached through Monday. Cloud cover will reduce maximum temperatures below warning criteria Tuesday however it is expected to remain humid. Significantly cooler temperatures will arrive Tuesday night. Please refer to your public forecast for further details. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-22T17:32:31-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and increasingly humid airmass will continue into tomorrow. Border line heat warning criteria is expected to be reached again. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can cause the air quality health index to approach the high risk category. Please refer to your public forecast for further details. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of daytime high temperatures near 29 degrees Celsius combined with overnight lows near 14 degrees Celsius continues today. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-22T12:59:38-00:00

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A few thunderstorms possible this afternoon and evening. Thunderstorms are expected to develop in this hot and humid air mass this afternoon and evening. Some of these storms may briefly become strong producing wind gusts to 80 km/h, pea to dime size hail and heavy downpours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and increasingly humid airmass will continue streaming into the regions from the south. Border line heat warning criteria is expected to be reached again into Monday. A cold front will move through to bring an end to the heat late Monday. Please refer to your public forecast for further details. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms continue to develop along a surface trough this afternoon and will continue into the evening. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 39 are expected for the next 2 days. The heat wave will continue into the week. Time span: Monday and Tuesday. Maximum temperatures on Monday 30 to 32 degrees Celsius (Humidex 35 to 39). Minimum Temperatures Monday Night: 15 to 19 degrees Celsius. Maximum temperatures on Tuesday 30 to 32 degrees Celsius (Humidex 35 to 39). Locations: New Brunswick except along the Fundy Coast. Remarks: Hot and humid conditions will redevelop Monday and continue through Tuesday for most of New Brunswick. The Fundy coast, however, should cool tonight and stay below warning criteria for the remainder of the week. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-22T16:45:06-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Another heat wave with begin for the Annapolis Valley on Monday. Time span: Monday and Tuesday. Maximum temperature Monday: 29 degrees Celsius (Humidex 37). Minimum temperatures Monday night: 18 Celsius. Maximum Temperature Tuesday: 30 degrees Celsius (Humidex 35). Locations: Annapolis Valley. Remarks: Another run of very warm days is on it's way. However, temperatures tonight will cool to below heat warning criteria and provide some relief for the overnight hours before very warm temperature return on Monday. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Information is provided on the Nova Scotia Department of Health and Wellness website at https://novascotia.ca/heat-related-illness/. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-22T17:00:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-22T01:01:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1624028052.2020
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms continue to develop along a surface trough this afternoon and will continue into the evening. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-22T09:54:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-22T01:08:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0619768649.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:41 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located 5 km west of Calgary and is nearly stationary. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-22T02:40:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-21T23:42:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2266334530.2020
Area: Rocky View Co. near Bragg Creek and Tsuu T'ina Res.
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:14 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located 5 km north of Black Diamond and is moving to the southeast at 25 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-22T04:11:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-22T01:15:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2732772323.2020
Area: Foothills Co. near Priddis and Brown-Lowery Prov. Park, Foothills Co. near Turner Valley and Black Diamond, Foothills Co. near Okotoks and De Winton, Foothills Co. near High River and Aldersyde

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:39 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located 15 km southwest of Caroline and is moving slowly to the south. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
